body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the US states of Tennessee and North Carolina:
examples: Great Smoky Mountains National Park attracts twice as many people annually as the Grand Canyon and three times the number of Yellowstone.
In Tennessee's Great Smoky Mountains National Park hemlocks tower 150 feet and can reach 500 years old.
